item.title: 'They have planned to arrest Atishi': Kejriwal responds to BJP's criticism on AAP's welfare schemes - The Times of India
item.description:
Kejriwal Defends AAP's Welfare Initiatives Against BJP's Criticism

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has responded to opposition criticism from the BJP regarding the welfare schemes implemented by the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), asserting that the party stands by its initiatives aimed at uplifting citizens.

  • Kejriwal claims that the BJP plans to tarnish AAP's image through arrests.
  • The AAP has implemented several welfare schemes that benefit the underprivileged.
  • Kejriwal emphasizes the importance of these schemes in fostering social welfare.
“They have planned to arrest Atishi,” Kejriwal states, suggesting political motivations behind the actions of the BJP.

This response highlights the ongoing political tensions between AAP and BJP, with Kejriwal defending his party's record while countering criticism surrounding its governance.

item.title: ‘Fraudulent…without any authority’: Delhi departments issue public notices against 2 AAP schemes - The Indian Express
item.description:
Delhi Govt Disowns AAP's Health Schemes, Calls Them Fraudulent

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

In a surprising development, senior officers from the Delhi government have publicly disowned two schemes initiated by Chief Minister Atishi and former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. The schemes were aimed at providing financial support to non-tax paying women and free healthcare to seniors.

  • The Delhi government states the Mukhyamantri Mahila Samman Yojna and Sanjeevani Yojna have not been officially approved.
  • Public notices label these schemes as fraudulent, warning against unauthorized application collection.
  • Kejriwal criticized the opposition BJP for attempting to undermine the initiatives.
  • The health department's notice calls out the influx of public inquiries seeking information on the unapproved schemes.
“These people are rattled by the Mahila Samman Yojana and Sanjeevani Yojana. They have planned to arrest Atishi ji in the next few days by filing a fake case.” — Arvind Kejriwal

This episode highlights the ongoing tensions between the elected government and the bureaucratic structure overseeing Delhi.

item.title: Christmas in space mystery: Astronauts’ festive photo sparks gravity-defying questions - 'Are they in fil - The Times of India
item.description:
Christmas in space mystery: Astronauts’ festive photo sparks gravity-defying questions - 'Are they in film studio?'

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

A recent photo taken by astronauts during Christmas has led to curiosity and speculation about whether they are actually in space or if the image was staged in a film studio.

  • The photo shows astronauts celebrating Christmas in what appears to be a zero-gravity environment.
  • Some viewers are questioning the authenticity of the photo and speculating about possible filming techniques used.
  • Experts are weighing in on the debate about space photography and the challenges of capturing images in a microgravity environment.
"The way objects float in this image raises some eyebrows and provokes interesting discussions about space and reality."

This festive photo has sparked conversation around space exploration and the visuals that often accompany it, prompting both excitement and skepticism from the public.

item.title: Toyota global production down for 10th month despite rising sales | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Toyota Global Production Down for 10th Month Despite Rising Sales

Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Reuters

Toyota Motor's global production decreased for the tenth consecutive month in November, despite an increase in worldwide sales driven by strong demand in the U.S. and China.

  • Toyota manufactured 869,230 vehicles globally in November, down 6.2% year-on-year.
  • U.S. output declined by 11.8%, with a slow recovery noted as production for certain SUV models resumed.
  • China's production fell by 1.6%, an improvement over the previous month’s 9% decline.
  • Japan witnessed a 9.3% decrease in output, influenced by a two-day halt at some plants.
  • Worldwide sales rose by 1.7% to 920,569 vehicles, setting a record for November.
  • In the January-to-November period, global output was down 5.2% compared to the previous year.
'Toyota has decided to build an independent plant in Shanghai to manufacture electric cars for its Lexus brand starting in 2027.' – Nikkei

In conclusion, while Toyota faces production challenges, it continues to achieve record sales in a competitive market, signaling resilience amidst adversity.

item.title: PM Modi pens article on Atal Bihari Vajpayee on 100th birth anniversary: ‘Wasn't one to cling on to power’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi pens article on Atal Bihari Vajpayee on 100th birth anniversary: ‘Wasn't one to cling on to power’

Date: Wednesday
Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid homage to Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his 100th birth anniversary, highlighting his pivotal role in India's progression into the 21st century and his impact on the country's economic rise.

  • Modi described Vajpayee as a statesman who inspired many and emphasized his principled stance on power.
  • He noted Vajpayee's remarkable leadership during the 1998 Pokhran nuclear tests as emblematic of India's scientific capability and leadership.
  • Modi praised Vajpayee's refusal to cling to power, recounting his resignation in 1996 rather than engaging in unethical politics.
  • Modi highlighted Vajpayee's commitment to the Constitution and his significant contributions to India's technological advancement.
“He stands tall as a statesman who continues to inspire countless people,” - PM Modi

In conclusion, Prime Minister Modi's article is a heartfelt tribute to Atal Bihari Vajpayee, reflecting on his values, vision for India, and lasting legacy in the country.

item.title: Australia Name Playing XI For Boxing Day Test Against India, Make 2 Huge Changes - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Australia Names Playing XI for Boxing Day Test Against India

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Australia has announced their playing XI for the Boxing Day Test match against India, which starts on Thursday, featuring two significant changes to the lineup.

  • Scott Boland replaces the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Teenager Sam Konstas will debut, taking Nathan McSweeney's place.
  • Travis Head has recovered from a minor thigh strain and is fit to play.
“Trav is good to go, so he will play. No stress, no worries about injury for Trav.” - Pat Cummins

The five-match series is currently tied 1-1, following a win for India and a decisive victory for Australia.

item.title: Canadian colleges under ED's scanner for illegally trafficking Indians into US - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Canadian Colleges Investigated for Trafficking Indians into the US

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has launched an investigation against certain Indian individuals, entities, and Canadian colleges for allegedly trafficking Indians into the US through Canada. The probe stems from a tragic incident in 2022 involving the deaths of a family from Gujarat while attempting to cross the border illegally.

  • The investigation targets Bhavesh Ashokbhai Patel and associates accused of human trafficking.
  • Individuals were charged between ₹55 and ₹60 lakh for illegal entry into the US.
  • Search operations were conducted at eight locations across various Indian cities.
  • About 25,000 students are referred annually by one entity for overseas college admissions.
  • Over 112 colleges in Canada are implicated in the ongoing investigation.
“All the accused, in conspiracy with each other, lured the innocent Indian nationals by charging them huge amounts for causing them to illegally enter the USA through Canada,” ED statement.

The ED's investigation underscores the dire circumstances that lure individuals into seeking illegal pathways for migration, emphasizing the need for stringent measures against such trafficking schemes.

item.title: Pushpa 2 The Rule worldwide box office collection Day 20: Allu Arjun film hunts down Baahubali 2, Dangal records; breaks Rs 1600 cr barrier - The Indian Express
item.description:
Pushpa 2 The Rule worldwide box office collection Day 20

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Director Sukumar’s blockbuster Telugu-language film, Pushpa 2: The Rule, has been on a record-breaking spree since its release last month, maintaining strong performance despite competition.

  • On its 20th day, Pushpa 2 collected Rs 14.2 crore in India.
  • The film surpassed Rs 700 crore in lifetime nett collections, becoming the highest-earning Hindi film ever.
  • Globally, Pushpa 2 has crossed the Rs 1600 crore mark.
  • It is now the third-biggest Indian film of all time, following Baahubali 2 and Dangal.
  • Most revenue has come from the Hindi version, with significant earnings from China.
  • The film's success has been overshadowed by a tragic incident during a screening.
"Pushpa 2 has now passed the Rs 1600 crore mark, making it the third-biggest Indian film of all time."

In conclusion, Pushpa 2's success at the box office is remarkable but is complicated by the controversies surrounding its screenings and the star's involvement in recent incidents.

item.title: "Stands Tall As A Statesman": PM Modi Remembers Atal Bihari Vajpayee - NDTV
item.description:
PM Modi Remembers Atal Bihari Vajpayee on His Birth Centenary

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his birth centenary, highlighting his contributions to India's political stability and development.

  • Atal Bihari Vajpayee is celebrated as a statesman who inspired many.
  • Modi emphasized Vajpayee's role in transforming India into the 21st century.
  • Notable achievements during Vajpayee's tenure included advancements in IT and telecommunications.
  • The Golden Quadrilateral Project was highlighted as a significant infrastructure achievement.
  • Vajpayee's government initiated the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan to promote education accessibility.
  • Modi praised Vajpayee's leadership during the nuclear tests in Pokhran in 1998.
  • Vajpayee was recognized for his commitment to protecting the Constitution and democratic values.
  • His contributions to Indian culture and literature were acknowledged, showcasing his poetic talent.
“Atal Ji’s unwavering belief in the potential of our nation continues to inspire us to aim higher and work harder.” - PM Narendra Modi

In conclusion, PM Modi called for a dedication to fulfill Vajpayee's ideals and visions for India's future.

item.title: Is stock market closed on Christmas Day? Read key updates - Zee Business
item.description:
BSE and NSE Closed for Christmas; Trading Resumes Thursday

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

The stock market, including the equity, derivative, and SLB segments, will remain closed on December 25 in observance of Christmas. The Multi-Commodity Exchange (MCX) will also suspend trading for both sessions.

Trading holidays in 2025

In 2025, markets will observe 14 trading holidays, down from 16 in 2024. Key holidays include:

  • Mahashivratri on February 26
  • Good Friday on March 28
  • Independence Day on August 15

Several holidays will fall on weekends, leading to fewer midweek breaks for traders.

Market Performance on December 24

On December 24, domestic indices showed positive movement, with the Sensex rising 167 points to 78,714, and the Nifty50 gaining 53 points to 23,806.50.

Sectors like Nifty Auto, FMCG, IT, Pharma, and Realty performed well, while Nifty Bank, Media, and Metal faced selling pressure.

Key Stocks in Focus

Tata Group stocks were notable, with Tata Investment Corporation surging 10% and Tata Motors leading the Nifty50 with nearly 5% gain amid optimism over a Rs 15,000 crore IPO for Tata Capital.

Plan Your Trades

Traders should stay informed with market announcements and sector trends to make the most of upcoming sessions.

item.title: Lyft Accuses San Francisco of $100 Million Tax Overcharge | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Lyft Accuses San Francisco of $100 Million Tax Overcharge

Publication Date: N/A

Source: Bloomberg

Lyft Inc. has filed a lawsuit against the city of San Francisco, claiming it has been overcharged $100 million in taxes over five years due to misclassification of driver compensation.

  • Lyft argues that taxes were calculated based on total passenger payments rather than Lyft's revenue model.
  • The company claims this method violates its constitutional rights and misrepresents its financials.
  • The lawsuit highlights ongoing disputes regarding gig economy companies and their classification of workers.
  • Lyft is seeking refunds for overpaid taxes, interest, penalties, and fees.
  • This case follows similar tax disputes with other companies, including Uber.
“Lyft doesn’t take operating in San Francisco for granted and we love serving both riders and drivers in our hometown city,” the company stated.

The outcome of this lawsuit could have implications for how gig economy companies are taxed and classified, potentially affecting future operations in the city.

item.title: Trump’s call for US control of Greenland prompts Denmark to boost defence - The Times of India
item.description:
Trump’s call for US control of Greenland prompts Denmark to boost defence

Publication Date: 2023-10-20

Source: Times of India

The article discusses former President Donald Trump's recent proposition for the United States to gain control over Greenland, leading to Denmark enhancing its military defenses.

  • Trump suggested that the US should take control of Greenland during a recent speech.
  • His comments were met with mixed reactions in the US and globally.
  • Denmark plans to increase military spending in response to these remarks.
  • The historical context of US-Denmark relations over Greenland is highlighted.
“This could be a serious shift in the geopolitical landscape,” stated a diplomatic source.

The event emphasizes the ongoing political tensions and the international implications of Trump's statements regarding Greenland.

item.title: Delhi airport issues advisory as flights may get affected amid dense fog; GRAP 4 lifted as AQI improves - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Airport Advisory Due to Dense Fog as GRAP 4 Measures Lifted

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Indira Gandhi International Airport issued an advisory due to dense fog conditions affecting flight schedules and train services in Delhi. The Central government's GRAP 4 measures were lifted following an improvement in air quality.

  • Dense fog enveloped parts of Delhi, leading to flight disruptions.
  • At least 20 trains were reported running late due to the fog.
  • The overall minimum temperature in Delhi fell to 9°C on Wednesday.
  • GRAP 4 measures were lifted as air quality improved to 'Very Poor' (AQI 333).
  • Future weather forecasts indicate a potential drop in temperature and the possibility of light rain or snowfall.
“The improvement in air quality was attributed to favourable meteorological conditions, including improved wind speed.”

In conclusion, the dense fog has raised concerns for travelers, while the lifting of GRAP 4 measures reflects some progress in air quality management in the region.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Will Rohit Sharma and Usman Khawaja, Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant, finally stand up? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why is Boxing Day Test not a sacred tradition, but reflects power of marketing and Kerry Packer

Publication Date: December 25, 2023

Source: Indian Express

In Melbourne City, the festive atmosphere is vibrant as people prepare for the Boxing Day Test, yet beneath the excitement lies the truth: this event is shaped by marketing rather than tradition. Dr. Thomas Heenan from Monash University explains how the Boxing Day Test gained prominence only after Kerry Packer revolutionized cricket broadcasts.

  • The Boxing Day Test has become a staple of Australian culture but lacks historical tradition.
  • It was only after 1979, with Kerry Packer acquiring broadcast rights, that the event surged in popularity.
  • Initially, the day was reserved for other cricketing events, with minimal attendance until marketing strategies changed public perception.
  • The significance of Australia's historical oppponents, such as the West Indies and England, has evolved with the growing presence of Indian players.
  • Current team performance raises questions on batsmen's capabilities, highlighted by rookie challenges and pitch conditions.
“Boxing Day Test is a perfect example of the power of marketing,” says Dr Thomas Heenan.

This reflection on the Boxing Day Test reveals how cultural events can be crafted through marketing, showing that traditions can be shaped in modern times rather than handed down through generations.

item.title: Christmas 2024: Where is Santa Claus? Follow his sleigh in real time as he delivers gifts worldwide - The Times of India
item.description:
Christmas 2024: Where is Santa Claus?

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Santa Tracker Coalition

As Christmas approaches, excitement builds as families around the world track Santa Claus's journey delivering gifts, utilizing real-time tracking technology.

  • Follow Santa's path in real-time as he travels across the globe.
  • Engagement with interactive features for children and families to enjoy.
  • Global impact, spreading joy and anticipation during the holiday season.
"The joy of the season is magnified by the magic of following Santa on his journey around the world." - Santa Tracker Coalition

Use this opportunity to teach children about global cultures and the spirit of giving, all while enjoying holiday traditions.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Are India ready to make changes to ensure spearhead Jasprit Bumrah gets reinforcement? - The Times of India
item.description:
Boxing Day Test: Are India ready to make changes to ensure spearhead Jasprit Bumrah gets reinforcement?

Date: MELBOURNE

Source: Times of India

As India prepares for a critical fourth Test against Australia, discussions are underway regarding potential changes to their lineup to better support pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah. The team is contemplating the introduction of an additional pacer or spinner based on pitch conditions.

  • The Indian team is considering playing an extra pacer in light of pitch conditions favoring fast bowlers.
  • Rohit Sharma acknowledges the team's reliance on Bumrah's exceptional form.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy’s dual role as a lower-order batter and occasional medium-pacer is under scrutiny.
  • Rohit spoke about the challenges of utilizing their current squad effectively given their players' form.
"It's a challenge to handle not just the bowling but the entire team. When somebody is in form, we have to make the most of that." - Rohit Sharma

The outcome of this decision may play a pivotal role in determining the success of the series for India.

item.title: Sports Ministry Reacts To Khel Ratna Row Involving Manu Bhaker: "No List..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sports Ministry Reacts To Khel Ratna Row Involving Manu Bhaker: "No List..."

Date: August 25, 2024   Source: NDTV

The Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports has clarified that double Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker has not been excluded from the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award list, and the final names for the National Sports Awards are yet to be finalized.

  • MYAS sources state, "There is no list finalised for National Sport's Awards yet."
  • Manu's father, Ram Kishan Bhaker, expressed disappointment over her name not being shortlisted.
  • He emphasized the need for sports legends on the selection committee.
  • Manu has made history by winning two bronze medals in the Paris 2024 Olympics.
  • She was the first Indian woman shooter to win an Olympic medal.
"It was very shocking to see that Manu Bhaker wasn't considered by the committee for the Khel Ratna Award." - Ram Kishan Bhaker

Despite the controversy, the MYAS assures that decisions have yet to be made regarding the awards.

item.title: Pakistan conducts airstrikes on Afghanistan killing 15; Taliban vow retaliation - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pakistan Conducts Airstrikes in Afghanistan, Resulting in 15 Casualties; Taliban Promises Retaliation

Date: Dec 25, 2024 - Source: Hindustan Times

In a rare military action, Pakistan conducted airstrikes on Taliban hideouts in Afghanistan, targeting suspected militant positions and leading to significant civilian casualties. The Taliban has condemned the attacks and pledged retaliation, marking a further escalation in the already strained Pakistan-Afghanistan relations.

  • Airstrikes were reported on December 24, targeting suspected Taliban locations in the Barmal district of Paktika province.
  • At least 15 individuals, including women and children, were killed, with the toll expected to rise.
  • The conflict underscores the ongoing tensions between the Afghan and Pakistani governments, particularly regarding cross-border militant activities.
  • The Pakistani Taliban has increased attacks against state forces, with Islamabad accusing the Afghan Taliban of providing them sanctuary.
“The Islamic Emirate will not leave this cowardly act unanswered but rather considers the defense of its territory and territory to be its inalienable right.”

The recent airstrikes not only exacerbate the existing humanitarian crisis but also highlight the fragile geopolitical landscape between the two nations.

item.title: Pakistan launches series of airstrikes on Afghanistan, at least 15 killed - The Times of India
item.description:
Pakistan launches series of airstrikes on Afghanistan, at least 15 killed

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The article discusses a recent series of airstrikes conducted by Pakistan in Afghanistan, which have reportedly led to at least 15 fatalities.

  • The airstrikes targeted militant positions in Afghanistan.
  • This operation marks a significant escalation in ongoing tensions between the two countries.
  • Pakistan claims the strikes were a response to cross-border attacks.
“We must take decisive action against any threats to our security.” - Pakistani military spokesperson

The recent airstrikes underscore the fragility of security in the region and the ongoing conflicts in border areas.

item.title: 'Pushpa 2' box office collection day 20: The Allu Arjun starrer is unstoppable as it makes Rs 14.25 crore - TOI Etimes
item.description:
'Pushpa 2' Box Office Collection Day 20: Highest Grossing Indian Movie Ever

Publication Date: December 26, 2023

Source: Times of India

'Pushpa 2' has surpassed the record previously held by 'Baahubali 2', making a total collection of Rs 1089.85 crore across all languages, continuing its strong performance at the box office.

  • The film made Rs 14.25 crore on its 20th day.
  • Total collection now stands at Rs 1089.85 crore, with Rs 701.65 crore from the Hindi version and Rs 321.05 crore from the Telugu version.
  • The film experienced a slight drop on Monday but rebounded on Tuesday, likely due to increased foot traffic from the Christmas holiday.
'Pushpa 2' achieved more than Rs 50 crore on its third weekend alone.

The film's remarkable box office run demonstrates its popularity and audience appeal, solidifying its status in Indian cinema history.

item.title: Stock market holiday: NSE, BSE shut today for trading on account of Christmas 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock Market Holiday: NSE and BSE Closed for Christmas 2024

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 - Source: Live Mint

The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) will be closed today for trading due to Christmas. This marks the last stock market holiday of the year.

On December 25, 2024, no trading or settlement activities will occur in various stock segments, including derivatives and securities lending. Additionally, major global markets in the UK, US, and Europe will also be closed.

  • No trading in stocks, derivatives, or SLB on December 25.
  • Currency and commodity markets will be closed for the entire day.
  • Trading will resume on December 26, 2024.
  • The next holiday is Mahashivratri on February 26, 2025.
The last stock market holiday of the year is on Christmas, allowing for a break in trading activities.

This holiday is significant as it affects trading schedules and investor activities during the festive season.

item.title: Delhi airport advisory: Low visibility may affect non-CAT III compliant flights - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi Airport Advisory: Low Visibility Impacting Non-CAT III Flights

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

An advisory has been issued for flights at Delhi airport due to low visibility conditions, particularly affecting non-CAT III compliant flights.

  • The low visibility is attributed to weather conditions.
  • The advisory is expected to cause delays and rescheduling of various flights.
  • Passengers are advised to check with airlines for updates.
“Travelers should remain informed about their flight status and plan accordingly.”

This advisory highlights the importance of adhering to operational standards for safe air travel.

item.title: 'I don't think Virat Kohli is out of form' - says Ravi Shastri - The Times of India
item.description:
I don't think Virat Kohli is out of form - says Ravi Shastri

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Former India coach Ravi Shastri has commented on the performance of Virat Kohli and Steve Smith, suggesting they are still formidable players despite recent struggles in Test cricket.

  • Joe Root and Kane Williamson have excelled in 2024, pushing Kohli and Smith down the ranks.
  • Kohli and Smith have shown they can return to form during the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Kohli's recent performance averages 25.06, significantly lower than Root's impressive 55.77.
  • Shastri emphasizes the importance of application and discipline to regain form.
“If Virat gets over that first 30-40 minutes with serious application and discipline, I don’t think he's out of form.” - Ravi Shastri

The discussion highlights the competitive nature of Test cricket and the high expectations from past stars like Kohli and Smith. Their resurgence in form could be crucial for India in upcoming matches.

item.title: Trump vows to pursue executions after Biden commutes most of federal death row - The Hindu
item.description:
Trump Promises to Pursue Executions After Biden Commutes Federal Death Row Sentences

Date: December 25, 2024, Source: The Hindu

President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to “vigorously pursue” capital punishment following President Joe Biden’s decision to commute the sentences of most federal death row inmates. Trump criticized Biden's actions as senseless and a disservice to victims' families.

  • Trump's statement comes after Biden commuted the sentences of 37 out of 40 federal death row inmates.
  • Biden argued that the commutations align with a moratorium on federal executions, except in specific cases.
  • Trump plans to direct the Justice Department to pursue the death penalty for violent offenders after taking office.
  • Polling shows mixed support for the death penalty in America, with a noted decline in support over the years.
  • Legal experts express skepticism about the feasibility of Trump's intentions under current law.
“Joe Biden just commuted the Death Sentence on 37 of the worst killers in our Country,” Trump stated on social media.

In response to Biden's actions, Trump seeks to reinstate and expand the use of the death penalty, potentially affecting cases involving serious crimes such as drug trafficking and murders. The future of capital punishment in federal cases remains uncertain amidst varying public opinions and legal challenges.

item.title: AUS vs IND: Australia make Travis Head call, announce playing XI for Boxing Day Test - India Today
item.description:
Australia vs India, 4th Test: Australia make Travis Head call, announce playing XI for Boxing Day Test

Published On: Dec 25, 2024

Published By: Akshay Ramesh

Australia confirmed their playing XI for the fourth Test on Christmas, reinstating Travis Head following a groin injury concern and ensuring that teenager Sam Konstas makes his debut.

  • Travis Head passed a fitness test and will play in the Boxing Day Test after concerns from the third Test.
  • Sam Konstas, aged 19, will debut as one of Australia's youngest openers.
  • Mitchell Marsh remains in the playing XI despite speculation about his form and fitness.
  • Scott Boland returns in place of the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Australia aims for an aggressive opening stand with Konstas and Usman Khawaja.
“Trav (Head) is good to go, he'll play… no worries about injury with Trav.” - Pat Cummins

This match marks a crucial point in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy as Australia looks to capitalize on Head's presence and Konstas's promising talent.
